alert.note: Alert for Coffee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 10 at 12:11AM CST until December 10 at 4:00AM CST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Alabama, including the following counties, Coffee and Geneva. * WHEN...Until 215 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1210 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elba, Enterprise, Fort Novosel, New Brockton, Kinston, Turner Crossroads, Richburg, Goodman, New Haven, Woodland Grove Church, Clintonville, Ino, Camp Alaflo Bsa, Mixons Crossroads, Tabernacle, Alberton, Holley Store, Rhoades, Victoria and Eanon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
